qas.question: What percentage of those elected from 1868 to 1876 were Freemen?
Freeman became the leaders of what party in Charleston?
What else did freed slaves face in postwar Charleston besides discrimination?
For what did the Federal forces remain in Charleston?
Which side was defeated in the war before Reconstruction?
What percentage of those elected from 1868 to 1886 were Freemen?
Freeman never became the leaders of what party in Charleston?
What else did freed slaves face in prewar Charleston besides discrimination?
For what did the Federal forces leave Charleston?
Which side was defeated in the war after Reconstruction?

context: After the defeat of the <a4_0><b9_0>Confederacy<b9_0/><a4_0/>, federal forces remained in Charleston during the <a3_0><b8_0>city's reconstruction<b8_0/><a3_0/>. The war had shattered the prosperity of the antebellum city. Freed slaves were faced with <a2_0><b7_0>poverty<b7_0/><a2_0/> and discrimination, but a large community of free people of color had been well-established in the city before the war and became the leaders of the <a1_0><b6_0>postwar Republican Party<b6_0/><a1_0/> and its legislators. Men who had been free people of color before the war comprised <a0_0><b5_0>26%<b5_0/><a0_0/> of those elected to state and federal office in South Carolina from 1868 to 1876.
